verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Tyre. <S%H6865><s%> Howl, <S%H3213><s%> you ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish; <S%H8659><s%> for it is laid waste, <S%H7703><s%> so that there is no house, <S%H1004><s%> no entering <S%H935><s%> in: from the land <S%H776><s%> of Chittim <S%H3794><s%> it is revealed <S%H1540><s%> to them.

Be still, <S%H1826><s%> you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the isle; <S%H339><s%> you whom the merchants <S%H5503><s%> of Zidon, <S%H6721><s%> that pass <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> have replenished. <S%H4390><s%>

And by great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> the seed <S%H2233><s%> of Sihor, <S%H7883><s%> the harvest <S%H7105><s%> of the river, <S%H2975><s%> is her revenue; <S%H8393><s%> and she is a mart <S%H5505><s%> of nations. <S%H1471><s%>

Be you ashamed, <S%H954><s%> O Zidon: <S%H6721><s%> for the sea <S%H3220><s%> has spoken, <S%H559><s%> even the strength <S%H4581><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> I travail <S%H2342><s%> not, nor <S%H3808><s%> bring <S%H3205><s%> forth <S%H3205><s%> children, neither <S%H3808><s%> do I nourish <S%H1431><s%> up young <S%H970><s%> men, nor bring <S%H7311><s%> up virgins. <S%H1330><s%>
As at the report <S%H8088><s%> concerning Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> so shall they be sorely pained <S%H2342><s%> at the report <S%H8088><s%> of Tyre. <S%H6865><s%>
Pass <S%H5674><s%> you over <S%H5674><s%> to Tarshish; <S%H8659><s%> howl, <S%H3213><s%> you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the isle. <S%H339><s%>

Is this <S%H2063><s%> your joyous <S%H5947><s%> city, whose antiquity <S%H6927><s%> is of ancient <S%H6924><s%> days? <S%H3117><s%> her own feet <S%H7272><s%> shall carry <S%H2986><s%> her afar <S%H7350><s%> off to sojourn. <S%H1481><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> has taken this <S%H2063><s%> counsel <S%H3289><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> the crowning <S%H5849><s%> city, whose <S%H834><s%> merchants <S%H5503><s%> are princes, <S%H8269><s%> whose traffickers <S%H3669><s%> are the honorable <S%H1935><s%> of the earth? <S%H776><s%>

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> has purposed <S%H3289><s%> it, to stain <S%H2490><s%> the pride <S%H1347><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> glory, <S%H6643><s%> and to bring <S%H7043><s%> into contempt <S%H7043><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the honorable <S%H3513><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Pass <S%H5674><s%> through your land <S%H776><s%> as a river, <S%H2975><s%> O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Tarshish: <S%H8659><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> strength. <S%H4206><s%>

He stretched <S%H5186><s%> out his hand <S%H3027><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> he shook <S%H7264><s%> the kingdoms: <S%H4467><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has given a commandment <S%H6680><s%> against <S%H413><s%> the merchant <S%H3667><s%> city, to destroy <S%H8045><s%> the strong <S%H4581><s%> holds <S%H4581><s%> thereof.

And he said, <S%H559><s%> You shall no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H3254><s%> <S%H5750><s%> rejoice, <S%H5937><s%> O you oppressed <S%H6231><s%> virgin, <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zidon: <S%H6721><s%> arise, <S%H6965><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> over <S%H5674><s%> to Chittim; <S%H3794><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> shall you have no <S%H3808><s%> rest. <S%H5117><s%>

Behold <S%H2005><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of the Chaldeans; <S%H3778><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> was not, till the Assyrian <S%H804><s%> founded <S%H3245><s%> it for them that dwell in the wilderness: <S%H6728><s%> they set <S%H6965><s%> up the towers <S%H971><s%> thereof, they raised <S%H6209><s%> up the palaces <S%H759><s%> thereof; and he brought <S%H7760><s%> it to ruin. <S%H4654><s%>
Howl, <S%H3213><s%> you ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish: <S%H8659><s%> for your strength <S%H4581><s%> is laid waste. <S%H7703><s%>

And it shall come <S%H1961><s%> to pass in that day, <S%H3117><s%> that Tyre <S%H6865><s%> shall be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> seventy <S%H7657><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> king: <S%H4428><s%> after the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> shall Tyre <S%H6865><s%> sing <S%H7892><s%> as an harlot. <S%H2181><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> an harp, <S%H3658><s%> go <S%H5437><s%> about <S%H5437><s%> the city, <S%H5892><s%> you harlot <S%H2181><s%> that have been forgotten; <S%H7911><s%> make sweet <S%H3190><s%> melody, <S%H5059><s%> sing many <S%H7235><s%> songs, <S%H7892><s%> that you may be remembered. <S%H2142><s%>

And it shall come <S%H1961><s%> to pass after the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will visit <S%H6485><s%> Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> and she shall turn <S%H7725><s%> to her hire, <S%H868><s%> and shall commit <S%H2181><s%> fornication <S%H2181><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the world <S%H776><s%> on the face <S%H6440><s%> of the earth. <S%H127><s%>

And her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> and her hire <S%H868><s%> shall be holiness <S%H6944><s%> to the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> it shall not be treasured <S%H686><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> laid <S%H2630><s%> up; for her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> shall be for them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> sufficiently, <S%H7654><s%> and for durable <S%H6266><s%> clothing. <S%H4374><s%>
